description: Manifest detailing the deterministic, sequential stages for the Rollback Protocol (RRP). This sequence must be executed atomically by the RRP Handler upon an Integrity Halt (IH) to restore pre-S00 state.

stages.name: Capture IH Context Snapshot
stages.action: Secure all volatile memory traces (MPAM, SGS) and timestamp IH occurrence. Lock file system state.

stages.name: State Reversion Pointer Check
stages.action: Validate integrity and cryptographic signature of the S-1 Checkpoint (Pre-S00 Initial State).

stages.name: Artifact Isolation and Quarantine
stages.action: Move all GSEP-C generated artifacts (CSR, ECVM, TEMM) into the IH Quarantine Zone. Zero out working memory buffers.

stages.name: Atomic State Restore
stages.action: Apply S-1 Checkpoint state atomically across all subsystems. This must be the primary commitment vector.

stages.name: Post-Restore Verification & Seal
stages.action: Execute hash validation against the known good S-1 Checkpoint. Upon successful match, cryptographically seal the IH RCA Report and authorize system restart.
